标题：No honey before 12 months
类型：规则
区域：Global
风险级别：high
摘要：Avoid honey and honey-containing foods during the first year to prevent infant botulism.
原因：Honey can contain Clostridium botulinum spores. Infant intestines cannot block toxin production, leading to potentially fatal paralysis.
应做：Choose pasteurized alternative sweeteners if needed, Remind all caregivers and childcare providers about the honey restriction
避免：Do not feed raw or processed honey to infants under one year, Do not coat pacifiers or bottles with honey
来源：HealthyChildren.org - Honey Guidance（评级：A，机构：American Academy of Pediatrics）

标题：Offer iron-rich foods daily from 6 months
类型：规则
区域：Global
风险级别：medium
摘要：Serve iron-rich animal or fortified plant foods every day starting with first solids to preserve iron stores and prevent anemia.
原因：Infant iron stores are depleted by 6 months; daily heme and non-heme sources maintain growth and cognitive development.
应做：Rotate heme iron options (beef, dark poultry, salmon) two to three times weekly, Pair plant sources like lentils or beans with vitamin C fruits or vegetables, Keep iron-fortified infant cereal or legumes in the meal rotation if accepted
避免：Do not let dairy displace iron-rich foods at mealtimes, Avoid delaying iron-rich foods until teeth erupt
来源：Canada.ca - Feeding Your Baby 6 to 12 months（评级：A，机构：Health Canada）；Guideline: Complementary feeding of infants and young children 6–23 months of age（评级：A，机构：World Health Organization）；Iron requirements in the first two years of life（评级：A，机构：Canadian Paediatric Society）

标题：Maintain 90-90-90 posture and avoid high-risk foods
类型：规则
区域：Global
风险级别：high
摘要：Seat infants upright with hips, knees, and ankles at 90 degrees and avoid round, firm foods such as whole grapes or hot dogs. Supervise meals without distractions.
原因：Proper seating and food preparation reduce airway obstruction risk, the leading cause of feeding-related injury in infants.
应做：Use a high chair that provides trunk support and footrest contact, Slice grapes, cherry tomatoes, and hot dogs lengthwise before cutting into small pieces, Keep mealtimes calm—sit with the child and supervise actively
避免：Do not allow children to walk, run, or ride in a car while eating, Avoid hard, round, sticky foods that cannot be mashed easily
来源：HealthyChildren.org - Choking Prevention（评级：A，机构：American Academy of Pediatrics）

标题：Supplement breastfed infants with 400 IU vitamin D daily
类型：规则
区域：Global
风险级别：low
摘要：Provide 400 IU of vitamin D daily from birth for breastfed or partially breastfed infants; reassess after 12 months when the target increases to 600 IU.
原因：Vitamin D supports bone and immune health; breast milk alone does not meet the requirement.
应做：Start vitamin D drops soon after birth for exclusively or partially breastfed infants, Review dosing at well-child visits once the child reaches 12 months, Demonstrate proper administration (onto nipple or inside cheek)
避免：Do not exceed recommended doses without clinician guidance, Do not assume formula-fed infants need supplementation if intake already provides 400 IU
来源：HealthyChildren.org - Vitamin D for Babies（评级：A，机构：American Academy of Pediatrics）

标题：No juice before 12 months; limit to 4 oz/day at 12–24 months
类型：规则
区域：Global
风险级别：medium
摘要：Infants under one year should not drink fruit juice. Toddlers 12–24 months may have up to 4 oz/day of 100% juice served in a cup with meals only.
原因：High sugar beverages displace nutrient-rich feeds and increase risk of dental caries and diarrhea.
应做：Offer breast milk or formula as primary fluids before 12 months, From 12 months, prioritize whole fruit and water, If serving juice, choose 100% fruit juice and limit to meal or snack times
避免：Do not give juice in bottles or allow continuous sipping, Avoid sweetened beverages and juice drinks
来源：HealthyChildren.org - Juice Recommendations（评级：A，机构：American Academy of Pediatrics）；CDC - Foods and Drinks to Avoid or Limit（评级：A，机构：Centers for Disease Control and Prevention）

标题：Transition off bottles by 12–18 months
类型：规则
区域：Global
风险级别：medium
摘要：Introduce cups around 6–9 months and plan to stop routine bottle use between 12 and 18 months to protect oral health and appetite regulation.
原因：Continued bottle use beyond 18 months increases risk of dental caries and interferes with appetite self-regulation.
应做：Practice with open or straw cups starting around 6–9 months, Offer water in a cup with meals once solids begin, Gradually replace bottle feeds with cup feeds after 12 months
避免：Avoid sending infants to bed with a bottle, Do not allow continuous bottle sipping throughout the day
来源：CDC - Fingers, Spoons, Forks, and Cups（评级：A，机构：Centers for Disease Control and Prevention）

标题：Choose low-mercury fish 1–2 times per week
类型：规则
区域：Global
风险级别：low
摘要：Offer low-mercury fish such as salmon, sardines, trout, pollock, tilapia, or shrimp in age-appropriate portions 1–2 times per week to provide DHA and protein.
原因：Low-mercury fish provides essential omega-3 fatty acids while minimizing neurotoxic mercury exposure.
应做：Use the FDA/EPA Best Choices list for infants and toddlers, Serve cooked fish with bones removed and texture matched to the child, Rotate species to provide diverse nutrients
避免：Avoid high-mercury species (shark, swordfish, king mackerel, tilefish), Do not serve raw or undercooked fish to infants or toddlers
来源：FDA/EPA - Advice about Eating Fish（评级：A，机构：U.S. Food and Drug Administration）

标题：Fruit juice limits for 12–36 months
类型：规则
区域：US
风险级别：medium
摘要：Do not serve juice before the first birthday. Limit 100% fruit juice to 4 oz (120 mL) per day for ages 12–36 months and offer only in a cup with meals.
原因：Excess juice contributes to dental caries, diarrhea, and displacement of nutrient-dense foods.
应做：Prioritize whole fruit and water, If offering juice, choose 100% fruit juice and serve in an open or straw cup, Pair juice with meals or snacks rather than between meals
避免：Avoid juice in bottles or sippy cups for constant sipping, Do not serve sugar-sweetened beverages or juice cocktails
来源：HealthyChildren.org - Juice Recommendations（评级：A，机构：American Academy of Pediatrics）

标题：Follow the 2-hour/1-hour cold storage rule
类型：规则
区域：Global
风险级别：medium
摘要：Discard prepared foods left at room temperature beyond 2 hours—or 1 hour if above 90°F (32°C)—and reheat leftovers to an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).
原因：Bacteria multiply rapidly in the danger zone, increasing risk of foodborne illness in infants.
应做：Refrigerate cooked foods within 2 hours (1 hour in hot weather), Use coolers and ice packs when travelling with expressed milk or prepared foods, Reheat leftovers thoroughly and stir to distribute heat evenly
避免：Do not refreeze thawed purées or formula once warmed, Avoid leaving perishable foods in the “danger zone” (40–140°F)
来源：FoodSafety.gov - The 2-Hour Rule（评级：A，机构：FoodSafety.gov）

标题：Introduce whole cow’s milk after 12 months (16–24 oz/day)
类型：规则
区域：US
风险级别：medium
摘要：Do not substitute cow’s milk for breast milk or formula before 12 months. After the first birthday, offer whole cow’s milk in cups and limit to 16–24 oz (480–720 mL) daily alongside iron-rich meals.
原因：Cow’s milk lacks the iron infants need and excessive intake can cause iron deficiency and dental caries.
应做：Transition to whole cow’s milk gradually after 12 months using cups, Keep total daily milk 16–24 oz to protect iron absorption and appetite, Discuss fortified alternatives with a clinician if dairy intake is low
避免：Do not replace breast milk or formula with cow’s milk before 12 months, Avoid sending the child to bed with a bottle of milk
来源：HealthyChildren.org - Cow's Milk and Your Child（评级：A，机构：American Academy of Pediatrics）

标题：Maintain tolerated allergens in the diet weekly
类型：规则
区域：Global
风险级别：medium
摘要：After successfully introducing allergens such as peanut or egg, maintain exposure at least once per week (often several times per week) to support tolerance, per NIAID and CPS guidance.
原因：Regular ingestion helps maintain tolerance established by early introduction trials (LEAP, PETIT).
应做：Create a weekly rotation that includes each tolerated allergen, Adjust portion sizes to age and consistency (e.g., thinned peanut butter), Consult an allergist for high-risk infants or if maintenance is difficult
避免：Do not rely on a single exposure and then stop for weeks, Avoid whole nuts or thick nut butter lumps in children under 4 years
来源：Caring for Kids (CPS) - Peanut allergy prevention（评级：A，机构：Canadian Paediatric Society）；NIAID Guidelines for the Prevention of Peanut Allergy in the United States (2017)（评级：B，机构：National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases）

标题：Spread calcium-rich servings across the day (700 mg target)
类型：规则
区域：Global
风险级别：low
摘要：Toddlers 12–24 months need roughly 700 mg calcium daily; offer two to three portions of dairy or fortified alternatives spaced between iron-rich meals.
原因：Calcium supports bone mineralization, but excess dairy can crowd out iron; spreading servings balances both needs.
应做：Serve 120–180 mL (4–6 oz) portions of milk, yogurt, or fortified soy beverage with meals or snacks, Check plant-based beverages provide vitamin D and at least 300 mg calcium per cup, Pair calcium foods with snacks so iron-rich main meals stay the focus
避免：Avoid sweetened or unfortified plant drinks as a primary milk source, Do not exceed 24 oz (710 mL) of milk daily without medical guidance
来源：HealthyChildren.org - Cow's Milk and Your Child（评级：A，机构：American Academy of Pediatrics）；Vitamin D supplementation for Canadian infants（评级：A，机构：Canadian Paediatric Society）；Calcium Fact Sheet for Health Professionals（评级：A，机构：NIH Office of Dietary Supplements）

标题：Rice cereal is optional—lead with iron-rich variety
类型：规则
区域：Global
风险级别：low
摘要：Choose any iron-rich first foods—meat, legumes, fortified cereals—and rotate grains to limit arsenic exposure from rice.
原因：CDC and CPS emphasize iron density and variety; rice cereal can be part of the rotation but is not mandatory and contributes more arsenic than other grains.
应做：Offer smooth meat or legume purées alongside fortified cereals, Rotate oat, barley, or multigrain cereals instead of serving rice cereal daily, Watch infant cues and adjust textures gradually
避免：Do not add cereal to bottles without clinician advice, Avoid serving rice cereal multiple times per day
来源：CDC - When, What & How to Introduce Solid Foods（评级：A，机构：Centers for Disease Control and Prevention）；Guideline: Complementary feeding of infants and young children 6–23 months of age（评级：A，机构：World Health Organization）；Iron requirements in the first two years of life（评级：A，机构：Canadian Paediatric Society）

标题：Transport expressed milk with cold-chain safeguards
类型：规则
区域：Global
风险级别：medium
摘要：When commuting or traveling, keep expressed milk at 4	C or colder with ice packs and label containers with pump time before handing off to caregivers.
原因：USDA, TSA, and CDC guidance stress continuous cold chain to prevent bacterial growth and maintain nutrient quality.
应做：Pack milk in an insulated bag with at least two frozen ice packs, Label each container with infant name, pump date, and time, Transfer to a refrigerator (4	C/39	F) or freezer within 24 hours
避免：Do not leave expressed milk at room temperature beyond four hours, Avoid partially thawing and refreezing milk
来源：USDA FSIS - Danger Zone 40°F-140°F（评级：A，机构：USDA Food Safety and Inspection Service）；TSA - Traveling with Children（评级：A，机构：Transportation Security Administration）；Expressing and storing breast milk safely（评级：A，机构：Centers for Disease Control and Prevention）

标题：Carrot
类型：食物档案
区域：Global
适龄：6-8m, 9-12m
喂养方式：puree, blw
风险级别：low
营养重点：vitamin-a, fiber
摘要：Carrots provide beta-carotene to support vision and immune health.
如何准备：
- 6-8m：Steam until very soft and mash or puree until smooth.（质地：Soft mashable purée；准备：Peel, slice, steam 8–10 minutes until a fork goes through easily, then mash.；提示：For BLW, cut into thick batons and lightly coat with oil to reduce sticking.）
- 9-12m：Serve as pea-sized cubes or soft finger strips.（质地：Tender, easily squashed between fingers；准备：Continue steaming until fork-tender before dicing.；提示：Pair with iron-rich foods such as egg yolk or lentils.）
份量建议：响应式喂养，初期每餐提供 1-2 大勺即可。
来源：Canada.ca - Feeding Your Baby 6 to 12 months（评级：A，机构：Health Canada）

标题：Salmon
类型：食物档案
区域：Global
适龄：6-8m, 9-12m
喂养方式：puree, blw
风险级别：medium
营养重点：protein, iron, omega-3
摘要：Salmon is a low-mercury fish rich in DHA, protein, and vitamin D.
如何准备：
- 6-8m：Flake cooked salmon and mix with breast milk, formula, or vegetable purée to form a soft mash.（质地：Soft, moist flakes that mash easily；准备：Bake or steam 10–12 minutes until fully cooked; check for pin bones.；提示：Retain natural oils to provide DHA.）
- 9-12m：Serve as soft fish cakes or loose flakes.（质地：Tender, breaks apart readily；准备：Combine with sweet potato or oats for fish cakes; pan-sear lightly.；提示：Offer once or twice weekly as part of the low-mercury fish rotation.）
份量建议：每周 1-2 次，每次约 1-2 汤匙起步。
来源：Canada.ca - Feeding Your Baby 6 to 12 months（评级：A，机构：Health Canada）

标题：Grape
类型：食物档案
区域：Global
适龄：9-12m, 12-24m
喂养方式：blw
风险级别：high
营养重点：vitamin-c, fiber
摘要：Whole grapes match the size of a child’s airway and are a leading choking hazard.
如何准备：
- 9-12m：Peel, deseed, and cut lengthwise into four thin strips.（质地：Soft, juicy strips that squish easily；准备：Wash thoroughly, remove seeds, slice lengthwise then again into quarters.；提示：Feed while the child is upright and supervised.）
- 12-24m：Quarter or eighth lengthwise into bite-sized pieces.（质地：Soft but still squishable；准备：Continue cutting lengthwise to maintain narrow shapes.；提示：Never serve whole grapes or crosswise coins.）
份量建议：作为餐后水果，每次提供 2-4 小块并观察咀嚼能力。
来源：HealthyChildren.org - Choking Prevention（评级：A，机构：American Academy of Pediatrics）

标题：Egg
类型：食物档案
区域：Global
适龄：6-8m, 9-12m
喂养方式：puree, blw
风险级别：medium
营养重点：protein, choline, iron
摘要：Eggs provide protein and choline; regular intake supports early allergen tolerance.
如何准备：
- 6-8m：Serve fully cooked mashed egg yolk mixed with breast milk or vegetable purée.（质地：Smooth mash；准备：Hard-boil for 10 minutes, mash yolk thoroughly.；提示：Offer a small amount for the first exposure and watch for reactions.）
- 9-12m：Offer scrambled egg or steamed egg cut into strips.（质地：Soft curds or custard-like strips；准备：Cook without added salt; slice into finger-length pieces.；提示：Maintain exposure several times per week once tolerated.）
份量建议：6-8 月每餐 1/4 个蛋黄起步，逐渐增加至半个蛋。
来源：CDC - When, What, and How to Introduce Solid Foods（评级：A，机构：Centers for Disease Control and Prevention）；Caring for Kids (CPS) - Peanut allergy prevention（评级：A，机构：Canadian Paediatric Society）

标题：Peanut butter
类型：食物档案
区域：Global
适龄：6-8m, 9-12m
喂养方式：puree, blw
风险级别：medium
营养重点：protein, healthy-fat
摘要：Peanut butter is an allergen that should be introduced in safe forms to build tolerance.
如何准备：
- 6-8m：Thin peanut butter with breast milk, formula, or warm water to a runny consistency and offer in small amounts.（质地：Smooth, pourable paste；准备：Mix 2 tsp peanut butter with 2–3 tsp warm liquid until thin.；提示：Offer first exposure at home during the day and observe for 2 hours.）
- 9-12m：Spread a thin layer on toast fingers or soft oat bars.（质地：Thin coating that dissolves easily；准备：Apply a 1–2 mm layer and serve with water or milk.；提示：Continue offering at least 3 times per week to maintain tolerance.）
份量建议：每次 2 茶匙稀释花生酱，至少每周 3 次。
来源：Caring for Kids (CPS) - Peanut allergy prevention（评级：A，机构：Canadian Paediatric Society）

标题：Shrimp
类型：食物档案
区域：Global
适龄：9-12m, 12-24m
喂养方式：blw, mixed
风险级别：medium
营养重点：protein, omega-3, iodine
摘要：Shrimp offers lean protein and omega-3s but is a common allergen requiring careful introduction.
如何准备：
- 9-12m：Steam and chop into pea-sized pieces or fine shreds.（质地：Tender, easy to mash；准备：Remove shell and vein; steam 3–4 minutes until pink before chopping.；提示：Offer first exposure at home with an allergy action plan.）
- 12-24m：Serve as soft finger pieces or mixed into fried rice/pasta.（质地：Soft with slight chew；准备：Ensure fully cooked and remove firm tail ends.；提示：Rotate with other low-mercury seafood.）
份量建议：9-12 月每餐 1-2 汤匙；12-24 月可逐渐增加至 1-2 盎司。
来源：FDA/EPA - Advice about Eating Fish（评级：A，机构：U.S. Food and Drug Administration）

标题：Lentils
类型：食物档案
区域：Global
适龄：6-8m, 9-12m, 12-24m
喂养方式：puree, mixed
风险级别：low
营养重点：iron, fiber, protein
摘要：Lentils provide non-heme iron, folate, and fiber for infants with vegetarian or mixed diets.
如何准备：
- 6-8m：Cook red or yellow lentils until very soft and blend with breast milk, formula, or broth for a smooth purée.（质地：Smooth purée；准备：Simmer lentils in water or sodium-free broth for 15–20 minutes until they mash easily.；提示：Add a teaspoon of canola or olive oil to boost calories.）
- 9-12m：Serve as thick mash or shape into soft patties for self-feeding.（质地：Soft mashable patties；准备：Combine cooked lentils with mashed sweet potato or oat flour to bind, then pan-sear lightly.；提示：Offer alongside vitamin C produce to aid absorption.）
- 12-24m：Mix into soups, stews, or dal with finely chopped vegetables.（质地：Tender lentils in sauce；准备：Continue cooking until lentils keep their shape but squash between fingers.；提示：Serve with whole grains to create a complete protein.）
份量建议：Start with 2–3 tablespoons and follow appetite cues.
来源：Guideline: Complementary feeding of infants and young children 6–23 months of age（评级：A，机构：World Health Organization）；Iron requirements in the first two years of life（评级：A，机构：Canadian Paediatric Society）

标题：Beef
类型：食物档案
区域：Global
适龄：6-8m, 9-12m, 12-24m
喂养方式：puree, blw
风险级别：medium
营养重点：iron, zinc, protein
摘要：Beef delivers heme iron and zinc, which have higher bioavailability than plant sources.
如何准备：
- 6-8m：Blend slow-cooked beef with broth or breast milk to a thin purée or offer meat broth on a spoon.（质地：Silky purée；准备：Pressure cook or braise boneless beef until shreddable, then blend with cooking liquid.；提示：Skim excess fat and avoid added salt.）
- 9-12m：Offer very soft shredded beef strands or finely minced patties.（质地：Moist, shreddable；准备：Shred along the grain and moisten with broth to prevent dryness.；提示：Serve with mashed beans or vegetables.）
- 12-24m：Serve tender meatballs or slow-cooked cubes cut into pea-sized pieces.（质地：Tender, easy to chew；准备：Cook ground beef with breadcrumbs or oats for softer texture.；提示：Drain grease and pat dry to remove excess fat.）
份量建议：Start with 1–2 tablespoons of purée; toddlers may take 30–60 g per meal.
来源：Canada.ca - Feeding Your Baby 6 to 12 months（评级：A，机构：Health Canada）；Guideline: Complementary feeding of infants and young children 6–23 months of age（评级：A，机构：World Health Organization）；Iron requirements in the first two years of life（评级：A，机构：Canadian Paediatric Society）

标题：Plain Yogurt
类型：食物档案
区域：Global
适龄：6-8m, 9-12m, 12-24m
喂养方式：spoon, mixed
风险级别：low
营养重点：calcium, protein, probiotics
摘要：Yogurt supplies calcium and probiotics that support gut and bone health in infants and toddlers.
如何准备：
- 6-8m：Offer plain, full-fat yogurt on a pre-loaded spoon or let the infant self-feed with caregiver assistance.（质地：Smooth and spoonable；准备：Use pasteurized yogurt without added sugar; stir in pumped milk to thin if needed.；提示：Avoid honey-sweetened yogurt before 12 months.）
- 9-12m：Swirl in mashed fruit or nut-free seed butter for additional nutrients.（质地：Thick, scoopable；准备：Use mashed berries or fruit purée; add iron-fortified cereal for texture.；提示：Offer with cup of water and an iron-rich side.）
- 12-24m：Serve as part of breakfast bowls with oats, chia, or sliced fruit.（质地：Thick, spoonable；准备：Portion 1/2 cup servings and keep chilled until serving.；提示：Choose unsweetened or <6 g added sugar per serving.）
份量建议：Start with 2–4 tablespoons and work toward 1/2 cup portions by toddlerhood.
来源：HealthyChildren.org - Cow's Milk and Your Child（评级：A，机构：American Academy of Pediatrics）；Vitamin D supplementation for Canadian infants（评级：A，机构：Canadian Paediatric Society）；Calcium Fact Sheet for Health Professionals（评级：A，机构：NIH Office of Dietary Supplements）

标题：Complementary feeding framework (6–12 months)
类型：指南
区域：Global
阶段：6-8m, 9-12m
指南类别：framework
摘要：Four-stage plan covering readiness, nutrient targets, and transition toward family meals for 6–12 month-olds.
正文：## Staged approach
- **Stage 1 (6–8 months):** Prioritize iron/zinc foods; start with smooth purées.
- **Stage 2 (8–10 months):** Add soft finger foods and open-cup practice; expand allergens.
- **Stage 3 (10–12 months):** Offer modified family meals with soft textures; encourage self-feeding.

## Caregiver reminders
- Breast milk/formula remain primary nutrition until 12 months.
- Aim for each meal to include an iron source, fruit/vegetable, and fat.
清单：
- [tip] Confirm the baby can sit upright with minimal support
- [action] Offer iron-rich foods twice per day in Stage 1

来源：Canada.ca - Feeding Your Baby 6 to 12 months（评级：A，机构：Health Canada）

标题：Hybrid BLW + spoon-feeding pathway
类型：指南
区域：Global
阶段：6-8m, 9-12m
指南类别：pathway
摘要：Blend self-feeding with spoon-feeding so infants practice oral-motor skills while meeting nutrition goals.
正文：## Why combine approaches?
- BLW fosters chewing and self-regulation; spoon-feeding ensures nutrient-dense foods.

## Implementation
1. Prepare two textures per meal: a soft finger food and an iron-rich purée.
2. Allow self-exploration first, then offer purée responsively.
3. Maintain 90-90-90 seating and choking precautions.
清单：
- [tip] Offer mashable finger foods at every lunch or dinner
- [action] Preload spoons to support self-feeding

来源：CDC - When, What, and How to Introduce Solid Foods（评级：A，机构：Centers for Disease Control and Prevention）

标题：Allergen introduction and maintenance plan
类型：指南
区域：Global
阶段：6-12m
指南类别：allergen
摘要：Introduce major allergens around 6 months under clinician guidance and maintain weekly exposure thereafter.
正文：## 步骤
1. 确认宝宝健康，无严重湿疹或已知过敏（如有请先咨询专科）。
2. 按顺序尝试花生、鸡蛋、牛奶制品、鱼、芝麻。
3. 每种食物首次少量，间隔 2 小时观察，再补足当天量。
4. 一周 3 次维持，避免超过两周未接触。
清单：
- [warning] 首次尝试安排在白天，家中备有紧急联系人

标题：Iron + vitamin D playbook (6–24 months)

指南类别：nutrition
摘要：Map out daily iron foods and vitamin D supplementation so toddlers hit both targets without overreliance on dairy.
正文：## Daily targets
- Offer at least two iron-rich servings (heme or fortified plant) every day.
- Keep vitamin D drops at 400 IU until the first birthday, then reassess 600 IU needs.
- Space dairy or fortified alternatives between iron meals.

## Weekly rhythm
- Plan 2 meat/fish meals, 2 legume meals, and 3 fortified cereal servings.
- Use sunlight and outdoor time alongside supplements when possible.

## Troubleshooting
- Check for constipation or refusal and adjust textures.
- Ask for bloodwork if appetite drops or pallor is noted.

标题：Holiday meal strategies for infants & toddlers

摘要：Keep routines, prevent choking, and manage leftovers during holiday gatherings.
正文：## Protect the routine
- Keep naps and feeding windows close to normal.
- Offer a familiar meal or snack before parties to reduce hanger.

## Buffet safety
- Plate toddler portions yourself and cut foods to pea-size.
- Skip whole nuts, popcorn, marshmallows, and raw veggies.

- Refrigerate within two hours (one hour if >32	C/90	F).
- Reheat leftovers to 74	C/165	F before serving.
